executive_summary: The Paint Manufacturing industry provides protective and decorative finishes for a variety of downstream markets. Paint manufacturers primarily supply the Construction sector with coatings for houses and commercial buildings; the industry also supplies the Manufacturing sector with paint for products such as cars, boats, consumer goods and more. In recent years, paint and coatings manufacturing has grown despite challenges from volatile interest rates and crude oil price increases. Low interest rates in the immediate aftermath of the pandemic spurred on new construction while industrial customers capitalized on improved supply chains and customer demand to ramp up production. Industry revenue has grown at a CAGR of 1.1% and is expected to reach a total of $33.7 billion in 2024 as revenue rises by an estimated 0.7%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry expansion followed growth in construction and manufacturing
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: US Paint Manufacturing industry revenue growth between 2019 and 2021 was largely driven by an increase in demand for residential construction and home improvement spending, fueled by low interest rates and increased per capita disposable income.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for new construction in 2021 bled into revenue growth for 2022
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for new construction in 2021 bled into revenue growth for Paint Manufacturing for 2022 in the form of previously planned construction projects, continuing revenue increases even as construction demand began to dip in 2022 and 2023. After hitting a low point in 2020 due to pandemic-related supply chain issues and depressed customer demand, industrial activity has experienced four consecutive years of growth between 2020 and 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Interest Rate Hikes Have Tempered Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2022 and 2023, the Federal Reserve increased interest rates in an effort to reduce rising inflation. The heightened cost of capital stifled previously growing demand for paint from the residential construction industry in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising costs and improved efficiency have raised profit
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic caused major disruptions to the industrial supply chain, but its recovery since then has provided substantial profit growth for paint and coatings manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Manufacturing and trade will drive growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In the coming years, as industrial production continues with slow but steady growth, the Paint Manufacturing industry in the US will benefit from increased demand from the manufacturing sector.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Deflated interest rates will spur demand from construction
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As inflation and in turn interest rates decline, the pressure on residential and nonresidential construction markets will lessen.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit and consolidation are set to rise
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As oil prices fall from their current elevated state over the coming years, paint and coatings manufacturing costs will drop.
